WRITING.TEXT: Sounds a bit to me like it could be a mix of things. For example being so young and it #8217;s yalls first baby while trying to learn the ropes and find that balance and possibly even some postpartum depression as it seems she detaches herself from the baby a bit too. I would try to get her in with a therapist to maybe help get out her frustration and anxiety.

The fact that my gym buddies always bail on me then put me down and get after me for going without them anyways. Like wtf just because you aren #8217;t going doesn #8217;t mean I #8217;m not allowed to sheesh

That #8217;s how mine started! Two of my friends had asked to be gym buddies. One always complains about doing #8220;land sports #8221; and how dumb it is (then why want to go to a gym where that #8217;s all there is?!?!?!) and the other seemed more motivated but either waits an hour after we were suppose to meet up to say anything or just is a no call no show. But you keep doing you! That #8217;s what I #8217;m doing and I #8217;ve just ignored the back lash. Seems to work but gets a bit annoying since I see them all the time in class

They #8217;re my only like two friends (I #8217;m in college and work almost full time and we #8217;ve been friends since middle school) so I don #8217;t have many options lol. But you #8217;re right. Once I move to be with my boyfriend at least I #8217;ll have him to go with me!

My bf put it best this way: one friend for some reason thinks that it #8217;s #8220;cool #8221; to hate land sports which is why she always brings up how much she hates it or how she can #8217;t do it and is #8220;content with being fat #8221;. Her words not mine. And how she loves carbs and food too much to give it up. And he made a good point that it #8217;s almost nearly impossible to change that mindset of someone so I don #8217;t even bother anymore trying to persuade her.

If they weren #8217;t long term friends I would #8217;ve. One genuinely I think wants to go but she gets bad anxiety so I think that might play a part in why she doesn #8217;t show. The other is just pure laziness and is very narcissistic and set in her ways. I might dump her tbh cause she #8217;s slowly getting on my last nerve
I have 3 more months as well! Then no more waiting since that #8217;s when I #8217;ll be moving in with him! #9786; #65039;
Or chances are that will be the last time anyone see or hears from you #129335; #8205; #9792; #65039;

Exercise is only a small part of losing weight honestly. The bare bones is calories in must be less than calories out. Sure exercise can help speed this up but the basics are just that simple. You don #8217;t need to go to the gym to notice change. Also up your protein intake as well. That will be way more important than just watching your carbs. Keeping track of all your macros in general is a good habit to get into.

I have! Just wrapped up Year 3 of a LDR and hoping to close the gap in June. My family was more of #8220;what happens if y #8217;all break up though? You won #8217;t have support there. Etc. etc #8221;. My answer is always id rather try and it not go as planned than to not try and wonder what could #8217;ve been. That seems to quiet them a bit. That and I #8217;m in that time of my life where I #8217;m not tied down. I #8217;m in college and haven #8217;t started a career advancing job yet or have a mortgage or anything to worry about if I were to move where as he has all that to worry about so it just makes sense. You just tell them it #8217;s your life and you want to try and make things work because it #8217;s what would make you happy. And if they were true friends and family that want you to be happy then they #8217;ll understand.
In my 8th grade science class we had to explain this to my science teacher. She legit thought that every time you ate an egg you were eating a baby chicken *facepalm*
Is there a cost difference in the two programs?

It #8217;s ultimately up to you. If you don #8217;t mind another year in school and the cost isn #8217;t crazy compared to the other program then go for the one that #8217;s 2 hours away. But from a financial perspective if this is a degree that can make you a lot more money coming out of it then I would choose the 1 year one. Yes it would be harder but if this is yalls future together than that one would give more financial stability (which finances can be a big burden on couples) Instead of being in school another year you #8217;ll be working instead and be able to be with your S.O. Faster. I would right the pros and cons out honestly and compare the two with your S.O. If it #8217;s this difficult of a choice.

So I #8217;m wrapping up a 3rd year of LDR being 14hrs away. Communication is literally everything being that many hours apart. It #8217;s really gonna depend on how y #8217;all are functioning as an LDR. My boyfriend and I have lasted this long due to us not having to be side by side constantly (some couples prefer that) with about 3 trips a year that we take turns taking. Personally we Skype about 3 times a week depending and those are like actual sit down and talk for a couple of hours and we text when we can of course. But not every relationship can withstand that. Some people need that physical presence and that, in my opinion, would probably be the deciding factor in this. But if you #8217;re going to be busy with school and if it #8217;s gonna be hard to put that time aside even with only being 2 hrs away than I would opt for the 12 hr option. It #8217;s one year compared to two and in my opinion less painless that way.
But how did c*nt become more offensive than other words? Like how did that one word get decided to be the most offensive?

But how do people decide that it #8217;s insulting to them? Like they just go #8220;idk what that means but it sounds mean so bad! #8221; Or? Like I #8217;m an American and I #8217;ve never heard of nonce so I #8217;d probably just give you a weird look and walk off lol. Sorry if this sounds confusing

He #8217;s says thank you!
I #8217;ve never been so disrespected in my life

As crappy as it may be, from the circumstances that your saying I unfortunately think he did it just to take your Virginity and run. Which is very very disgusting on his part. But this isn #8217;t your fault. AT ALL! You were manipulated into thinking he cared about you and loved you and wanted to start a future with you. After going through something like this which I #8217;m sure can be pretty traumatic, I would suggest completely cutting him off for now and getting some therapy to help build back up your self esteem and maybe get some better insight into what you need to do to help yourself and move on from this. And honestly if you were to try to get closure from him I highly doubt he would give you any, just give you the run around or try to place the blame on you. I #8217;m so sorry for what #8217;s happened and I hope you know that this isn #8217;t your fault and that you are amazing! And I hope you are able to get past this and build yourself back up again :)

Not me but my brother: Him and two of his friends were outside in the front yard playing football. We have a cactus garden right at the edge of our porch. His friend threw it too far but my brother was determined to catch it so it wouldn #8217;t pop if it landed in the cactus (this was his 3rd football) and took the fall himself and cradled the ball as he fell smack dab in the middle of the cactus garden. His ball survived! But he was covered in thorns. Took forever to get those pesky things off of him.

I hate monthly weight fluctuations with a passion. I #8217;m a 20 F and started at 155. Managed to drop 5 lbs and have put off exercising because of some personal stuff and just trying to maintain for a month before I hit the gym again, but every now and then for a few days I fluctuate back up towards 155 and it #8217;s the most obnoxious and depressing thing ever when I see the scale. I know it #8217;s normal but gosh I hate it so much.

I #8217;m free!!!!!!

She also tried to tell me the 8 hr between shifts wasn #8217;t a rule and said that just because I didn #8217;t want to work doesn #8217;t mean I can try to make up things to get out of it #128580;

I wish it was just one. We went through a whole change in management this time last year. All the ETLS got replaced except for our STL. It got to the point our new HR after almost a year couldn #8217;t get the schedule out on time so instead of the week schedule she had to tape out day by day. So if you didn #8217;t work but worked the next day you wouldn #8217;t know. It #8217;s been a mess. I have so many stories but maybe for another day lol.

WRITING.TITLE: A code red is a hell of a good time
WRITING.TEXT: So this happened around my 2nd month at target (I #8217;ve been here almost 2 years now). I was transitioning out of softlines training and had girls by myself and was pushing out freight. My store just had a remodel done a couples days before and had added the movable white walls that are out in apparel. I #8217;m putting up some girls accessories when I started to smell something burning. At first I thought it was food ave. But it got super strong and smelt like it was coming the opposite direction of the lanes. So as I #8217;m turning to the other side of the white wall a guest starts screaming fire and I look at my clearance rack and this crazy lady had set it on fire! I try to call a code red over the walkie(funny enough we just went over codes in a huddle like 30 mins prior) but another TM kept interrupting me. Finally LOD tells them to stop talking and asked for the location. So I said girls clearance. Our GSTL runs over and at this point I had managed to get guests away and take off clothes from the racks to keep it from spreading, he grabs a shirt and tried to put it out by hitting it only to have the shirt catch on fire. My LOD who is like 7 months pregnant at this point is yelling for someone to grab a fire extinguisher and finally the cart attendant comes around and manages to put the fire out. However bEcause of the utter chaos this caused nobody was watching the lanes and the lady managed to walk out with over $3000 worth of merchandise. Eventually she got caught but I heard from our AP she had done it to another target and a Walmart near us before they got her. So yeah needless to say it was pretty interesting and my mom was mad because I got a code red my first two months, she didn #8217;t get one for the first 10 years she worked for target lol. Always a cool story to share I think. And now it #8217;s used for training as an example when going over code Edit: thank you so much for the silver! It #8217;s my first time getting one! Ahhhh!!!!! *happy dance*
That #8217;s what I did but if you #8217;re in the middle of talking and someone presses their button it cuts you out
I know a kids shirt none the less lol. He was an interesting fella
They got him lunch afterwards :)

WRITING.TITLE: Had taking a pre/probiotic helped anyone with Their symptoms?
WRITING.TEXT: So I #8217;m new to the sub and have just been informally diagnosed with IBS -C (my primary thought my flair up was my appendix or gallbladder but those were ruled out with testing so now it #8217;s #8220;potentially #8221; IBS C but my insurance is fighting me on seeing a specialist even with a referral so I #8217;m not formally diagnosed. My primary had told me to start taking miralax to help with my constipation and to try a pre/probiotic but I was wondering before I go out and spend a bunch of money, if anyone has had any success with this and if so what yalls recommendations would be on brand or type? Edit: Symptoms include bloating with abdominal pain, constipation for days to the point I slowly begin to look almost 7 months pregnant, followed by a day or two of diarrhea and then a couple of semi normal days before the process begins again. And constant tiredness from all the fluctuations

WRITING.TITLE: Possible in home care job? Need advice
WRITING.TEXT: Background: So currently I #8217;m waiting to hear back from a CNA program and for money I work retail until I hear back from the program. Well my boyfriends Uncle has 2 family members who need in home care 24/7. The wife is all there cognitively but is just physically disabled and needs help to get around the house and eat. The husband on the other hand isn #8217;t really mentally all there but doesn #8217;t have any physical disability. You just have to keep him entertained and is apparently a super sweet guy (I #8217;ve yet to personally meet them). They pay $12/hr cash and are wanting me to watch them from 7am-7pm 3 days a week. Btw this is in Georgia. I am not yet certified as a CNA which they #8217;re aware of and are ok with. I just don #8217;t know if/when my program starts how that #8217;ll all work out. There #8217;s 3 other caregivers and they rotate their days so not one person gets stuck on the weekends every time but I would also like to stay with my retail job at least 2 days a week until classes. What do y #8217;all think?

I down a cup of coffee that had MCT oil in it. I learned by a fluke. I had ordered it and didn #8217;t realize it had that in it and about an hour later I was running to the bathroom. But I felt so much better afterwards. I just had to make sure I kept myself hydrated. Lots and lots of water after

Well mine was a keto coffee that already had it in it. I had ordered it from a friend and I was not expecting that but it #8217;s effects have slowly diminished the more I use because I guess my gut bacteria is getting use to the dosage. You #8217;re not suppose to have a lot of the MCT portion otherwise it can do more harm than good. But it #8217;s definitely worth a shot.

I actually ended up in the hospital and they had me take that. A worked for about a two months before the effects almost stopped which was sad because those were probably the most normal two months of my life for the past 3 years :/
